website_summaries.verdict: For those car owners who need an inexpensive but accurate tire gauge as part of an emergency road kit, this one fits easily in the hand and in the glove box.
pros: Ergonomic, soft grip improves seal on valve stem
Simple push-button operation controls all features
cons: Electronic components can fail over time

customer_reviews.title: Great product and you have more options for the same hardware
customer_reviews.text: This tire pressure gauge is great and very accurate. I checked it against much more expensive models. Also, it is the exact same unit as Tacklife TG01 Classic, so buy whichever one is cheaper or has the color you like. See pictures where I took them apart to verify the same parts on the inside as well. Sometimes the shell can be the same, but with different interior parts. These two are duplicates with different names.
customer_reviews.author: Einar Mikkelsen

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is also very poor (open it up and you'll see how flimsy and ...
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 3 reads. Doesn't turn on, even after changing the battery. Build quality is also very poor (open it up and you'll see how flimsy and poorly designed the internal components are. Dont waste your money in this cheap gimmick, buy professional reliable tire pressure gages (preferably analog ones)
customer_reviews.author: Erns Pen

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk, used sparingly over a year then it stopped working, save your money and get a trusty "thermometer" type tire pressure reader, they are accurate, don't need batteries, and reliable. EDIT 1/6/2018 Tekton saw this review and promptly sent a new replacement tire gauge. Since the tire gauge works well and they have excellent customer service I have changed my review to 5 stars. They really stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Greg29

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend. Hardly used it
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't recommend. Hardly used it. In the cold it would just flash and not work. Now I'm guessing it flashed so much it ran the battery down. It's got expensive lithium cells inside (4 of them two different sizes?!) so buying a new one is probably cheaper than buying the batteries. -1 star for not working in the cold, -1 star for flashing that ran the battery down, and -2 stars for not having rechargable battery or at least a replaceable one.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan del Mundo

customer_reviews.title: Great, Lightweight and Accurate - Plan to Buy More!
customer_reviews.text: Great pressure gauge! I'm really happy with how it works so far. Reads the same as 3 other gauge, both digital and old school mechanical. Light and lighted dial are really handy in the dark. I wish it were easier to lock it into PSI, as it is easy to accidentally switch it to other units. You can take reading after reading without waiting 30 seconds or turning it off. Lightweight and fits even large hands well. As for shutting it off... You can wait 30 seconds for the auto shutoff - OR - hold down the trigger button for 10 seconds. That shuts it off on demand. I will buy more for my other cars.
customer_reviews.author: ArcticMinibike

customer_reviews.title: HARD TO READ BLUE LIGHT, NOT ACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: I thought the light on this could be handy at night. The light is Blue, it's hard to read at night. Worse, the one I received is not accurate. I bought four different tire gauges, three agree, this one was out in left field. I'm returning it. Don't need batteries, don't need lights, just need correct tire pressure and this one does not deliver it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark KingTop Contributor: Bass Guitars & Gear

customer_reviews.title: After a year still working
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this maybe once a month for more than a year. I was surprised to see the display went blank. Ordered CR2016 from Amazon for a replacement battery. Opening the case is not a big issue just two Philip screws. Found 3 more batteries of different size and wondered if I ordered a wrong battery. Just moving the old CR2016 Battery a little the display started working again. Before you order a new battery, check the battery connection. One CR2032 3V Lithium Coin Cell - main battery for display and electronic Three LR44 1.5V Button Cells - for the LED light ( gauge works without these batteries)
customer_reviews.author: SPM

customer_reviews.title: Worthless junk
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of crap! Used it a dozen times and now it stopped working. I'm going back to an analog gauge. The other thing I don't like is you have to select the correct units (PSI for me). It's the same button you use to turn it on so every time you use the gauge, you have to make sure you've got the correct units selected. Unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wester

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money, broke at the first use
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this. The one I bought only lasted for 1 tire, during checking the second tire it had a hard time coming on. I managed to get through checking 1 vehicle but the gauge kept going into an error state where the display and light blinked constantly. I had to just trying and power off and on again to fix. If I got lucky I checked the tire. This product is unreliable and never worked. I tried to email their support email account but got no response. It's been a week. So if yours breaks outside of the Amazon return window you'll be suck with a broken product and no support. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work when needed
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work when needed on a dark night -- just meaningless flashing display. Disqualifying for a 15-month old product. When I got home, checked the Tekton website. No support -- no way to find a manual or instructions, which might explain potential problems. Did work on a couple of prior occasions, and an improvement on the old-fashioned tire gauges. But if it doesn't work when needed? Well, don't buy again, and don't buy any Tekton product again.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Iverson

customer_reviews.title: Sticking with this gauge after all
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of these gauges failed in cold weather, I switched to an analog gauge, even though the Tekton is easy to apply to the tire valve, easy to read, and seems to read accurately and consistently enough. But then my analog gauge gave me bad readings, like 5 PSI low. I found that unacceptable, and realized that the Tekton might fail unexpectedly, but it never gave a bad reading. So now I'm keeping a couple of spare Tekton gauges (they're cheap enough). However, if you live where it gets really cold, and you keep the gauge in the vehicle parked outside, then you should consider that the Tekton just might stop working in the cold.
customer_reviews.author: x475aws

customer_reviews.title: Unit is not durable. Housing is plastic and cracks easily
customer_reviews.text: This is my second gauge. The first one literally fell apart. The housing is plastic and so is the part that comes in contact with the tire valve. I kept it in the glove compartment and never in the trunk. That disintegrated. I ordered one to replace it last week. It arrived and did not work at all. The light would not come on. Even with the first one you had to use it 3-4 times to get a reading. I got an easier reading from my backup gauge I paid $1.00 at the dollar store. I do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: HOGANIZER

customer_reviews.title: Replace inferior battery
customer_reviews.text: The item I received was flickering on an off and was really unusable. If at all it managed to stay on, the moment I put it against the tire, it would turn off and then flicker on/off again. I was about to give up and throw it in the trash, but then saw that I had some spare batteries (CR2032, LR44) and decided to try replacing the battery and checking. So I opened it up. The CR2032 battery installed in it (some Chinese brand with Chinese letter on it) was not snug and I determined that must be the cause. Replaced it with a Duracell CR2032, which fit perfectly and thereafter it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Did not like this at all. Sometimes it would not even come on and other times it would just flash on and off like a strobe, a few times it turned on but then shut off after about 2 seconds. Returned this after only 1 day of use.
customer_reviews.author: Malorie penprase

customer_reviews.title: Has problem in cold weather
customer_reviews.text: This device is very handy and accurate. I've compared its readings with other gauges and it does well. The light is nice too. The one thing that disappoints me is that in cold weather (around 35 degree F) one of my units flashes on and off - this is not good, especially when you need it. My other unit totally died - I am sure the batteries are dead.
customer_reviews.author: bshaug

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't replace battery
customer_reviews.text: I've had the product for a while, and it works OK although I think the single button design where it's easy to accidentally change from PSI to other measures isn't great. The device now needs new batteries, and that's the reason for the 2* review. You have to take the device apart, and it has two deeply indented holes with small phillips screws you have to take out. I have a pretty good jeweler screwdriver set, and even with that I couldn't get the screws out. The head of the screw stripped. So the product has to be thrown away because I can't change the battery. Bad design
customer_reviews.author: JimF63

customer_reviews.title: I wish I hadn't wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: It stopped working after 18 months. If the battery needs to be replaced, they sure made it hard to access the battery compartment. There are a couple of tiny, deep set Phillips-head screws holding the thing together. I just noticed in the product description it says, "(1) CR2032 3V Lithium Coin Cell, (3) LR44 1.5V Button Cells (All Included)." Four batteries! Uuugh. I wish I hadn't wasted my money. I'm going to shop for a more traditional, non-battery type of tire pressure gauge that I can count on.
customer_reviews.author: Bowe

customer_reviews.title: Works good, and a good price..
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought a bunch of different digital tire pressure gauges, trying to determine the best one for our wide variety of vehicles.. This seems to be the winner. I’ve used them on trailer tires, truck tires, tractor tires, RV tires, and car and Jeep tires. I saw that they were on sale, so I bought a couple more, and now have one in the shop, one in my truck, and one in the RV. Are they “built like a tank”, No.. Will they last forever? No.. But, they work well, and at this price, you can buy another one when you lose or break it. I recommend this to anyone who would ask.
customer_reviews.author: R. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Questionable QC, hit or miss functionality
customer_reviews.text: These are hit or miss. I purchased one last year and it worked flawlessly until I lost it. This one was the same model and brand as my previous one, but it hasn’t worked since day 1. The accuracy of the psi measurement itself seem to be spot on. But there is some kind of contact short or issue with this most recent one. Press the button and the unit turns on. By the time I hook the gauge onto the stem, it restarts and goes to a blank screen. It takes several tries to get the psi reading and it seems like luck is the only way this works. Disappointed QC considering this is a highly regarded brand.
customer_reviews.author: Pidasso

customer_reviews.title: Takes a little practice, but works OK.
customer_reviews.text: It's kinda slow to turn on and zero and it's harder to hold it straight to get a good reading compared to a pen-type guage. Measured against a few other gauges and it reads almost 1.0psi high, but that's accurate enough given that the readout is only accurate to 0.5psi. I had a similar gauge before with a non-replaceable batter and the battery lasted about 7 years, so I hope this one lasts that long and I can replace the battery and go another 7 years.
customer_reviews.author: Brianosaurus

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, fast and easy.
customer_reviews.text: I had a collection of various dial type pressure gauges, and some pen type. Readings varied all over the place depending upon which gauge I picked up. I just wanted an accurate pressure gauge, so I could maintain the right air pressure in my tires. This little gadget is just what I needed. I just received it and checked my car and truck tires. Adjusted inflation and the car rides better. Nothing worse than a pressure gauge that is off 5 lbs. This one seems to be accurate as far as I can tell.
customer_reviews.author: Merlin

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE tire pressure gauge.
customer_reviews.text: Please I beg whoever is reading this DO NOT spend your money on this junk. Buy anything else in this world but this tire pressure gauge or give your money to someone in need. This was a waste of my money from day one. It’s always blink 8’s. Some days longer than others. It’s supposed to shut off after 30 secs of not being used. It never does. Today it won’t shut off over an hour now. This item SUCKS. It wasn’t expensive, but it should work. At least for a little while. It’s been trash since day one. You’ve been warned.
customer_reviews.author: James I.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work right out of box.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work right out of box. Display flashes with all segments lit. Wouldn’t turn off either (even after several minutes). Loose connection inside. Tapped on it and it started to read but the. Went back to flashing. Was “good used” “amazon warehouse deals inspected” (don't know how I ordered used?). Obviously returned once as defective already. Ordered replacement but with how many batteries it takes, it’s probably cheaper to buy a new one than the batteries!
customer_reviews.author: john hustins

customer_reviews.title: No car should be without one of these
customer_reviews.text: If you have a tire pressure idiot light that just tells you one of your tires has low pressure, then this sort of gauge is really helpful to identify the problem. It's also a good double check on gas station tire pressure pumps with those little pop-out lever gauges that never give the same answer twice. They seem to be quite inaccurate compared to this device. The lighted window and mini-flashlight is also quite handy at night. The only annoying thing is that the gauge reads in lots of different units and I seem to always forget to click the trigger to get it to read in psi the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Toyman

customer_reviews.title: Good gauge, forget replacing battery
customer_reviews.text: Owned mine for three years, had to replace the battery (2032) this summer. Never has worked right since then. I'll open it up, fiddle around with the (very flimsy) wires and internal parts, reassemble and test. It will work fine when I test it immediately. Wait an hour or so and it will fail to power up no matter how many times or how hard the button is pressed. I've assembled and reassembled this repeatedly with the same problem. I think it's replacement will be a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tom from CT

customer_reviews.title: Will not read in tenths.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this same tire guage a couple years ago and it was and still is great. I gave it to my son to keep in his car when he went off to college. I purchased this one to replace the one I gave away. The old one I had would give very accurate readings right down to single decimal points such as 32.1, 32.2, 32.3 and so on. This one will only read in 1/2 psi such as 32, 32.5, 33, 33.5 and so on. This makes getting your tire pressures even nearly impossible. After filling tires, the TPM system in my car shows pressures all over the place. So disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Steven W. Hoppe

customer_reviews.title: avoid, cheap, unreliable
customer_reviews.text: For some reason this item is not eligible for return even though it is fulfilled by Amazon. This thing is cheaply made, unreliable - can't get the same reading twice in a row, doesn't match my other expensive floor pump gauge or other much more expensive and well made digital gauge. It doesn't seat properly, lets out lots of air while trying to use it.
customer_reviews.author: W. Maes

customer_reviews.title: This digital gauge gives me the exact tire pressure that is required on my tires.....
customer_reviews.text: This digital tire gauge works perfectly. My Mercedes is equipped with the tire pressure sensors and every once in a while it will put a warning up on the dash display that the tire pressures are incorrect. I had one of the cheapy pocket tire gauges and it doesn't give an accurate reading. This digital gauge gives me the pressure reading down to the tenths of a PSI. Love it and it is simple now to get the CORRECT pressure on the tires.
customer_reviews.author: BlueMax

customer_reviews.title: This tool is great, but consider it disposable.
customer_reviews.text: This gauge is great and has worked for me the past couple of years with no issues. However, the battery is a pain in the ass to change because once you open the case up, there are quite a few components that become loose and the wires that connect them are very fragile at the soldering joints. Putting all of the little components in back in place to get the case snapped back on is very irritating. So my advice is that when the battery does burn out on this thing, just chuck the whole thing in the trash and get a fresh one from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Baron

customer_reviews.title: Great tire gauge with light
customer_reviews.text: This was on sale cheaper than my no-frills LED tire gauge, so grabbed it for my son's truck. Being a Tekton tool owner, this tire gauge being a Tekton-brand item I knew it had to be of good quality & I was right. Yes it has multiple read-outs of different pressures, but the LED light is most helpful vs having a separate flashlight checking tires @ night. When my no-frills LED gauge goes, I'm buying myself one of these Tekton tire gauges...
customer_reviews.author: 🐃 Buffalo Blue

customer_reviews.title: The most useless item ever made
customer_reviews.text: The most useless item ever made!! It doesn't work. It gives me gibberish reading. Why isn't this eligible for return? It is not a hygiene or food item!!! I wish I had looked at the return policy----the no return policy is always a red flag. I will complain to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: especially with the cheaper-priced items like this. I'm happy to say
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to tell if a product will end up working right when you're looking at it on a computer screen, especially with the cheaper-priced items like this. I'm happy to say, this digital gauge works perfectly. I've used it on my light truck and on a motorhome with tires up to 70 PSI no problem at all. If, for some reason, you're still using a pneumatic stick-gauge we all grew up using then you owe this to yourself. The only thing I would change is the auto-off feature is a bit on the fast side at 30 sec, but it's only a minor gripe.
customer_reviews.author: Mav

customer_reviews.title: Best gift for that tough guy who has EVERYTHING!
customer_reviews.text: My dad is a commercial contractor and he is literally able to work on anything, has all the tools you can imagine, isn’t exactly impressed with items. Amazon had this as a gift suggestion and I took the chance! Umm I am still getting a “thank you” a weekly! He uses it on all of our vehicles (have 5 siblings), his equipment , his friends stuff, and whatever else on the jobs! He has loved it, and it’s also been able to identify some potential for safety! Great gift, and I am lucky to have the ability to use it too whenever! Thanks for the recommendation Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Lillian Miles

customer_reviews.title: Does not last long.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gauge two months ago and have used it only twice. The features and design are good but the quality is not. The gauge stopped working properly the second time I went to use it. I push the button to turn it on, wait until it calibrates itself, and then measure the tire pressure. When I pull gauge off of the tire stem the display starts flashing and continues until the gauge times out and powers off. It will work just once the next time it is powered on and then flashes until it powers off. I would try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Rick M

customer_reviews.title: If all products were this well designed the world would be a beter place!
customer_reviews.text: I've always been fussy about tire pressure, especially with the changeable Texas weather (see Boyles Law). So I've tried many types of tire gauge and used several, including aneroids with a hose and a couple other digital gauges. This model is definitely the best I've ever used, so much so that I gave them to five family members and friends. The gauge illuminates the valve stem if you're in a dark garage, and is set at just the right angle to the stem so it's easy to get a good connection without losing a lot of air - a shortcoming of many gauges.
customer_reviews.author: AustinTexan

customer_reviews.title: Good value, works great
customer_reviews.text: This gauge works very well and is apparently accurate (I compared it to a dial-type gauge and it read withing 1 psi; however I don't have a lab-grade gauge for comparison). I like the light but the auto off is too fast for me. After I check a tire, by the time I put the valve cap back on, go to the next one, then take that cap off, it's already powered down. I'm not that quick so maybe that wouldn't be an issue for everyone. It was very reasonably priced and I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P

customer_reviews.title: I would reccomend it for the person who checks occasionally instead of every day or multiple times a day like me. It works very well at night
customer_reviews.text: The gauge is handy and the button isn't on a flat surface where it will always be getting pressed and running the battery down. Fits well in the hand, materials are light but not entirely cheap-feeling. Gauge was accurate on mine. After about six months of use, though, I accidentally angled it while checking a tire and felt something plastic snapping, and it wouldn't check pressures after that. I would reccomend it for the person who checks occasionally instead of every day or multiple times a day like me. It works very well at night!
customer_reviews.author: M Miner

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't turn on and Amazon won't take back.
customer_reviews.text: So this tire gauge just arrived and it doesn't work. The batteries come included it seems and when I tried to press the button to turn it on, nothing happened. There's only one button, so it's pretty clear which one to press. There weren't any instructions in the box which normally would not be a problem, but seeing as how it doesn't work, it makes it more complicated. So now I'm trying to get some help from Tekton who makes the device. I'm not sure why Amazon won't accept it as a return.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, ergonomic, and works well.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, lightweight, and accurate enough for home garage use. The reason I'm knocking off a start is that the clear plastic tip partially broke (mechanical stress from a valve stem) and seems like a part that should be overbuilt given the nature of the tool. Still, it holds a seal and doesn't have any problems that aren't cosmetic. The backlit screen is really indispensable. Overall quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Z

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and incredibly handy to have!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 7/2016. Anyone who owns a vehicle should have this! I drive on the beach for surf fishing and constantly have to air down to avoid getting stuck in the sand. It's one of those item, you didn't know you need until have it. Very easy to use and have a long battery life. Easy grip that fit your hand. Multiple different readings with hassle-free digital display. Very useful led light for use at night. The pressure reading is accurate. Best feature is auto-shutoff at 30 sec so you won't drain battery on accident. I highly recommend! If you find this review helpful, please click 'helpful' button at the end of this product review. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: CTN412

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS ITEM
customer_reviews.text: Arrived inoperable. I can see that a wire that's supposed to be connected to the "on" button is not connected. It's a very small wire/connection, not something I can fix with my real-life-sized tools, so I tried to return/exchange it. "This item is not eligible for return" No explanation, just this statement. I can imagine why, though, the manufacturer of this flimsy device would be flooded with returns. DON'T BUY THIS ITEM!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert R.

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy is Better than the Pencil Gauge
customer_reviews.text: Digital display is 10 times better than the old pencil gauges. However, the accuracy is not perfect, I can get within a few tenths and am satisfied with that. Now I can add or remove pressure without the guesswork. If you are done with the low tire pressure sensors and want some more accuracy and ease, this is perfect. Lightweight and fits in the glove box. Nice light on the tip allows easy placement on the tire stem and lit display for those shadows in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Notreace

customer_reviews.title: Consistent and easy to read
customer_reviews.text: I have never really liked those little silver tire gauges (the ones that look like pens) because it seems too subjective trying to take a reading - is that a 32? Maybe it's a 28? And if I took multiple readings, I would get multiple numbers, often very different (like a 20 and then a 34). Endlessly frustrating! So I looked on Amazon for something better, and decided I would try this. I'm happy! It gives an instant reading, in clear readable numbers, and is consistent and accurate time after time. Great product
customer_reviews.author: elaineTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: This tire pressure gauge is great. It is very accurate and extremely easy to use. It is much more reliable over those pop out pressure gauges. It gives me fast, consistent readings that I can trust. I've had it for a few years now and it is still functioning as it did the first day; I take care of it and don't toss it around. Considering the price, I would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: accurate, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this gage... easy to turn on, turns itself off automatically after use. The one they sent me seems to be very accurate (I Checked). The only down side I do not like about this gage... they built it to be used world wide, so it has all the pressure readings available (PSI / BAR /ETC) and when it is on, pressing the on button again changes the reading so every time a person uses it you not only have to read the pressure you are checking, you also have to make sure you did not accidentally switch the measurement while checking your tire.
customer_reviews.author: Helomech

customer_reviews.title: 100 psi works well and does light up nicely to see the reading
customer_reviews.text: This TEKTON 5941 Digital Tire Gauge, 100 psi works well and does light up nicely to see the reading. The size of the display is small but readable. It appears to be slightly off in the accuracy of reading the psi; but not enough that would affect a normal passenger or truck tire pressure. For the price, it is a nice gauge to have stored in a car especially if you are attempting to check the pressure when it's dark. I would purchase the TEKTON 5941 Tire Gauge again, but I would still also have a larger dial gauge in my garage as my main tool of choice.
customer_reviews.author: Homeowner

customer_reviews.title: Takes a few tries to read but otherwise good
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool product in theory and it's great when it works. However, half the time I try to use it, it doesn't read anything at all. I'm using it the exact same way I've used my other gauges that weren't digital, so I'm not sure why it takes a few tries for it to start working. Other than that, I've loved having the very clear, exact result of PSI since I've had problems with tires in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Tekton should stick to making hand tools
customer_reviews.text: Tekton should stick to making hand tools, now like most tools from China i highly doubt Tekton actually manufactures this, they just buy it with their sticker on it, it literally lasted 2 months with minimal use, it would randomly turn on and off while in use, changed the battery, didnt fix the issue, so i stored it in my Waste Management bin. My Accutire one lasted 7 years and cost the same....
customer_reviews.author: Thispriceisrighter

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have owned and I am 0 for 2. The first one wouldn't stay on long enough to take a reading so I returned it to the company for a replacement. The second one worked "mostly" as advertised for about three months, but now I am getting the dreaded flashing lights and then it turns off syndrome. Took out all four batteries and tested them and they were fine, put it back together and it still only works sporadically. Majorly frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Batteries Not Replaceable
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to use. I got about 3 years out of it. When I tried to use it a few days ago, I noticed it was dead. I figured the batteries are dead. There was no easy access to a battery compartment. I thought no big deal, it’s just two screws. When I opened it, I see this is not meant to have the battery replaced. It’s to be thrown away. It requires 1 CR2032 and 3 LR44. The wires are tight around the batteries and the LED and button fell out. What the hell? This is my first electric tire pressure gauge. I’m going back to pneumatic.
customer_reviews.author: Nino C. Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: OK, but could be much better. The good. Easy to read lighted guage. I tested it against my other gauges and all the readings were similar. The bad. NO bleed valve and not even a device on the unit to manually bleed the valve core stem. Put together with two screws that screw into plastic, not a brass bushing. Thus will not last a long time. Has four batteries, none of which most homeowners would have on hand and would likely cost more than the original tool. I would opt for a different gauge if I were to order a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Dan

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now
customer_reviews.text: We use this to check the tire pressure on our vehicle that we take out on the beach in Cape Cod. We had been using one of the pen shaped slide gauges which we found to be totally inaccurate. When you are driving on the sand, it is very important to have your tires at the correct pressure to avoid getting stuck. This gauge is perfect and allows us to test and bring all tires to exactly the same digital reading without the guess work from a pen slide gauge. The price is very affordable and this is a must have for every glove box.
customer_reviews.author: acemics niv

customer_reviews.title: Love this tire gauge!
customer_reviews.text: When my old digital tire gauge finally quit working after 12 years, I decided on theas a replacement. While I thought my old gauge was great, this one is even nicer. The display is easy to read, and the gauge connects to the valve stem without a struggle. I am completely pleased with this tire gauge and recommend it to anyone needing a good, accurate way to do that monthly check of your car tires' pressure.
customer_reviews.author: LuvDachsies

customer_reviews.title: This is a handy tire air pressure gauge
customer_reviews.text: This tire air pressure gauge works well. The readout is easy and registers right away. The auto off feature is convenient as well. My only complaint is that there is no memory of your reading preference after it shuts down. You will have to cycle through the different measurements to get to PSI every time you turn on the gauge. This in an inconvenience though and doesn't take much away from this tool's capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: J24

customer_reviews.title: There are better ones out there
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and easy to read however the battery died after about a year and a half and there is no battery indicator so when it dies it just starts to kind of wig out Like I start getting random digits popping up on the screen but it won’t detect any psi reading from my tire. The quality isn’t so good it feels like kind of cheap but it is very easy to use and for the time that it was working properly it was great
customer_reviews.author: John Waage

customer_reviews.title: Its Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like that this fits right into the palm of my hand; press it look at it tire pressure number easy to read display its easily stored in my glove compartment for use anytime i need it ! Screen lights up great no need to get your glasses to see price point great i think i got this for myself ladies tired of asking my husband to check my tire pressure! !haha its really nice
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: ... fits your hand perfectly and it makes a very good connection to the valve stem when taking a pressure ...
customer_reviews.text: This gauge fits your hand perfectly and it makes a very good connection to the valve stem when taking a pressure reading. I've never had a tire pressure gauge that was this easy to use. Although I have no way to calibrate the reading, it seems to be quite accurate based on my vehicle's tire pressure monitoring readout. It was so easy to use, I ordered another one for my sister who seems to have problems when she checks her tire pressure. I'm confident this gauge will solve her problem. I don;t think you will find a better digital gauge in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Chytka

customer_reviews.title: Nothing beats pneumatic gauges. This gauge is disposable.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. As soon as the battery runs out you have to throw it away. You could attempt to change the battery but it is a mess once you open the unit. Also, the unit is covered in some goo layer. When it gets hot in the car the unit becomes sticky to the touch. I will keep using my pneumatic gauge that does not need batteries and last forever.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: essential for your car!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and it works great. When your low pressure light comes on or you suspect something, this little tool lets you diagnose the problem right away. Very accurate for when filling up the tires to double check the air pressure machine is working right. Love this thing. Had to replace it after a few years because the batteries died, but its nice and cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This gauge, while easy to read, failed miserably with little use. It stopped working and, assuming the battery required replacement, upon trying to remove the tiny screws which are so deeply inset in the handle it wasn’t possible to remove both, the unit turned itself on and would not turn off. A complete piece of junk and waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Buster Kitten

customer_reviews.title: 3 + 1 battery! Hard to change too! Cheaply made!
customer_reviews.text: SO MANY SO MANY BATTERIES TO RUN THIS SMALL DEVICE! 4 batteries. 3 of a different style and 1 another style! Not normal at all! Super cheap! Bad idea and not work always. Hard to replace battery too!
customer_reviews.author: Raza

customer_reviews.title: replacement return every year
customer_reviews.text: going on my 3rd tire gauge replacement, thankfully they replaced it over the past years, have to spend up to 2 months with customer support to replace this because the digital readout goes out, may have to start looking elsewhere, but will keep trying, I use it for my reverse osmosis water filter, they ask me if its leaking water, it is not , so after 3 emails they will replace it again
customer_reviews.author: Beyous

customer_reviews.title: nice little tire gauge
customer_reviews.text: should of gotten one of these ages ago, i like how this tire gauge measures air. my cars tire pressure monitors are suppose to be accurate to 1 psi and they are not. this thing measures air to the tenth so its 32.5 psi and and you can drop it to 32.4 etc... until you hit 32psi on the dot. much better then the guesstimate with my old tire gauges
customer_reviews.author: blaster

customer_reviews.title: Best tire gauge I've had
customer_reviews.text: I've compared all kinds and makes of tire gauge. They usually give the most disparate readings. Even the expensive ones. I usually compare this with the gas station person's gauge, every time. I've had it in the motorcycle glove compartment for years now. Tire pressure is key on a motorcycle. My ongoing comparison tells me it's about the only really precise gauge around. One could type up a table and prove it, but I just don't have time. Much reccomended.
customer_reviews.author: Rolando Montao Fraire

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful tire gauge, minor issues.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because i am a car geek and i really love tires, of course that involves having the right pressure on my cars. The product is fine, i use it in PSI but the issue i see in this is that PSI are measured in 0.5 ranges, i know that this should not be a dead o alive matter, but you should know it. The tip that goes into the valve is plastic, it really feels very cheap, so what i do is handle it with care to avoid possible damage, for the price is a nice gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Defective Gauge Quickly Replaced by Seller
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: The seller replaced this digital tire gauge without even asking for the defective one to be sent back. I could immediately tell that the new gauge was working as it should. The customer service is unbeatable. Tekton simply "guarantees" its products without putting a time limit on them. So I'm happy--because Tekton really stands behind its products!
customer_reviews.author: The Veteran

customer_reviews.title: Battery doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these fail when I needed them. I leave them in the car so I have them when needed. It seems they don't like cold weather. When the temperature is below 35, two of these wouldn't work at all. To make matters worse, one of the two had the screws stripped, so I could not replace the batteries. Try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Midnight Rambler

customer_reviews.title: Personal Digital Tire Gauge
customer_reviews.text: This lightweight digital tire gauge has shown to be accurate so far. It fits nicely in my glove compartment and was already battery ready. I have only used it 2x but it read the same as the air compressor at the gas station. I like that it reads in many different settings. It will be beneficial to people in many different countries.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Charles

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, have purchased three
customer_reviews.text: I really love this tire gauge. We have bought 3 of these for various family members. The display is easy to read and seems to be accurate. The illumination is helpful in low light situations. The light does shut off fairly quickly to save battery, but that has not been a problem. The same button to activate the device also switches between english and metric units, so watch that.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S

customer_reviews.title: A good budget digitl air gauge
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My only minor complaint is that the refresh time between each reading takes a few seconds. You either need to cycle through the options to return to the desired reading measurement or turn it off and turn it on again if you don't want to wait the full time out cycle. Other than that very minor complaint I would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Unable to get 2 readings on the same tire consecutively
customer_reviews.text: Looking for an accuracy in pressure readings, I bought this gauge. Unfortunately every time I tried to use it, I got different readings. I finally noticed that when I pressed the button to turn it on, it did not go to zero. I switched to a mechanical (sliding scale) gauge which, while less accurate, gave me consistent readings.
customer_reviews.author: A. MCLAUGHLIN Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Fairly accurate to have as a backup gauge.
customer_reviews.text: The light is a nice feature, although the blue lighting was not a prime choice for visual clarity in the dark. Sometimes it takes a few times of pressing the power button to get the gauge to power on. Reading is fairly accurate, but my gauge reads two pounds over the actual pressure reading, as compared to 4 other gauges and my car's on-board gauge reading. It actually works great on my bicycle tires, and is more accurate with lower pressure tires.
customer_reviews.author: JDenny

customer_reviews.title: Good butit doesn't like the cold
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty great device to measure the psi on your tires. Seems accurate too. I really liked it. But.... Do not use in the cold! I checked my tires when it was in the single digits and the screen was on the fritz and then automatically turned off. So imo.. if you live in colder regions, I wouldn't suggest a digital. But If you live in warmer climate or it's summer, it is a great tool to use.
customer_reviews.author: Christian R.

customer_reviews.title: Early failure
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, I want to say that the exterior design, grip, material and initial function of this product was excellent. However. After purchasing this product in 2014, I only used it a total of four times. It sat in my closet while not in use. That is extremely little wear and has always been kept indoors. Now it no longer works and even after a battery change it has no effect. If it still worked after 4 uses, it would be an easy 5 star purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Risch

customer_reviews.title: Great, dependable tire gauge for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This tire gauge is amazing! I got sick of the wonky ones at the gas stations that seemed very fickle on whether air pressure was right from one reading to the next. Got this to use when airing up my tires and could not be happier! Very easy to use and has given an accurate reading every time without fail. Use this when airing up your tires anywhere and you'll do it perfectly every time. Keep this in my glove box and it has been a lifesaver when my low tire pressure light is on to figure out which one is having a tantrum that day. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia3

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy this item
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gauge to check tire pressures before as part of my pre-trip safety check on my camper trailer. next day the spare tire was flat, the tire valve was leaking. Replaced the shrader valve and re inflated, then checked truck and trailer tires. Next morning the truck tire was flat, yep tire valve failure.. Same issue with my bicycle. Turns out the pin in the pressure gauge damages the tire valves. Just tossed it in the garbage where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new car and thought I'd buy a new tire gauge. Did my research and the TEKTON 5941 was highly rated so I bought it. In the span of four months I used it twice, once in October and again in November. Last night I wanted to check the pressure in my spare tire and the TEKTON gauge didn't work. The blue light was very dim and the gauge didn't read my tire pressure. Really disappointing as it's so hard to find anything of quality anymore.
customer_reviews.author: rkd

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this product. Low quality. Difficult battery change
customer_reviews.text: This is a complete piece of garbage. It's nice how it lights up in the dark, but it's very fragile. To change the batteries, you have to remove two microscopic screws and the innards dump out when you open it. First time you drop it on pavement, the fragile exterior cracks badly. The batteries it came with lasted maybe two uses. Save your money...get something better.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to buy batteries
customer_reviews.text: Mine flickered on once. Before I even got a chance to use it, it stopped working. It's not worth it to me to find special batteries and disassemble a brand new gauge. It also comes without instructions, which adds the extra step of looking them up online if you're new at this. Worst purchase I've made in a while.
customer_reviews.author: AvalonSilver

customer_reviews.title: I think I have found my last and best tire pressure gauge
customer_reviews.text: At last I believe I have found my LAST tire gauge ! After trying at least 4 previous styles of tire gauges, this one is the best. #1 - the design allows for an easy yet tight fit between the gauge and the valve stem - something that few other gauges do. #2 once you have the proper fit it is quite easy to read the tire pressure displayed on the gauge. #3 - as best I can tell - this gauge is accurate to within 0.5 lbs of pressure. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Silicon Valley Guy

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: I use this to test my motorcycle. It was kind of hard to angle the product fishing it through the brakes to get a reading. I leave mine on the garage and it has been cold. I used it one time and it was cold and I couldn’t get a reading because it seems like it needed to warm up? It was just turning off after a few seconds of use. After it warmed up, it was fine. I don’t know how accurate it was because I could not compare it with anything but it seems like an okay product.
customer_reviews.author: GuapyChulo

customer_reviews.title: Worked two times
customer_reviews.text: It worked two times. The third time I went to use it, it keeps flashing. I can leave it for five minutes or more, and the light and display just keep flashing. I don't think it is the battery. I did open it up to replace the battery, but it takes 4 batteries. It takes 3 LR44 and one CR2032. I can buy a better tire gauge for less than the price of batteries for this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Saeed

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Battery lasts a few years.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Tekton gauge I am buying. After 2 and a half years, the battery died on my first one. Rather than replace the batteries (which I guess you can do), I bought another through an amazon "deal". It is easier to read than a mechanical gauge and was accurate while the battery lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Suziesilverado

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work or I don't know how to use it
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of this product, one for my daughter's Rav4 Jeep and one for my Honda CRV Jeep, I don't know if I was pressing to much to check the psi pressure of my tire that my tire was deflating, once I put it again the digital tire gauge and doesn't display the correct pressure of my tire. Waste my money.
customer_reviews.author: Luchi Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: I ask so little of this device. I keep it in my glove compartment and I pull it out maybe 4 times a year to check my tire pressure. I've now had two of them break on me. To the company's credit, they replaced the first one, although they tried to imply their device's malfunction was somehow my fault. The second one stopped working this morning. It's frustrating to have that happen when you're relying on it to work, in this case because my car is giving me a low tire pressure warning. It's cheap, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: The gauge is very very accurate, which is surprising for this sort of device. It works quite well, although it sometimes needs a bit of jiggling around. This was actually my second one, bought without hesitation. I didn't know that the battery in the original one could be replaced, which after five years or so shouldn't have come as a surprise to me.
customer_reviews.author: LLB200

customer_reviews.title: Got Defective device
customer_reviews.text: Bought it based on the reviews and being Amazon's choice, but couldn't turn it on. I opened it to figure out if something was wrong with a battery. Surprised to see four small batteries which are way expensive than AA or AAA. I still wonder why did they design this thing like this, which would require so many batteries in this small device? Even the device is working you would end up spending more than half of the original price just to replace the batteries. Thanks to Amazon which refunded the purchase amount after calling the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Quit after using 4-5 times
customer_reviews.text: I bought this some time ago but have only used it 4 or 5 times when it just quit working. As mentioend by others, it does come on spontaneously which likely wore the batteries down. Opened it to see if I could get a new battery - but the larger one simply won't come out. So - I give up.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth E. Mahlke

customer_reviews.title: Finish dissolving. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: This tire gauge seems to work OK. Readings match close enough to the gauge built into my air pump. However after a few years of occasional use the red finish is like wet paint. I picked it up and it took a while to get the red stain off my hand. In fairness I am in Florida and it gets warm in my garage but that should not matter.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Space-age gauge does what it needs to do
customer_reviews.text: This tire gauge is exactly what I needed. I wanted something a little "sexier" than a standard gauge to go with my new EV and this looks very cool. The display is easy to read, with the illumination making it easy in a darker setting like the garage and the LCD being very clear in direct sun. It's fast, accurate, and the extra light on the connector is nice for lining it up with the valve. It feels very light and some could call it "cheap" but it does what it does well which is what counts.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R.

customer_reviews.title: Sucks. Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Sucks. Don't waste your money. I used this twice and now the digital reader is spouting off all sorts of bizarre numbers. Total waste of money. Go to Auto parts store and pick one up from there. Keep your receipt incase it doesn't work worth a damn also!
customer_reviews.author: secludedbliss

customer_reviews.title: It is sufficient...appears slightly used.
customer_reviews.text: It came with a scratch out of the box. It looked like it was already used. Not happy about that. The device may takes some force to put on the tire, depending on where the nozzle is on the tire when parked. It can feel like it doesn’t fit properly when attempting to use. It is ‘okay’ for the price but feels like it should be a bit cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: DeChaun

customer_reviews.title: Works good for me.
customer_reviews.text: Works good. You have to get the proper angle of the valve stem to form a good seal. I don't know how long the batteries will last. It might be cheaper just to order another one of these instead of replacing the batteries. They sell very similar models of this device on Amazon, some even a little less expensive than this one. I'm not sure how they compare to this item. This is the first digital tire pressure gauge I ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: tm

customer_reviews.title: Close to perfect
customer_reviews.text: I like how it's almost close to perfect on reading the tire pressure almost on the first try. It has several settings to set it on. Choose the correctime setting in my case, psi. I read from other users that this is really accurate and I must say it is quite just that. Like one of the newest vehicles purchased at almost a month, has the correct tire pressure except the left front and the right rear it was off by .5 so I gave it some air and it all read correctly. Very impressed with it being this price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Au

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy wiring
customer_reviews.text: Very dissatisfied with this tire gauge. I only used this a few times when the battery died. When I replaced it, I noticed the wiring to the on/off button was detached or got loose. It looked like it needed to be soldered but of course I couldn't do that. So I can only conclude that the battery really did not die on me, but that the wiring got detached that's why it stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: C. Giroux

customer_reviews.title: Failed me when I really needed it
customer_reviews.text: Less than a year old and this fancy digital tire pressure gauge failed to work. Intermittant power, if any at all. I left this in my wife's car and when I was out of town, her car said a tire was low. She gut this device out of the car, but it would not work for her, so she was forced to go to a shop. I replaced it with a trusty mechanical traditional gauge. Works every time
customer_reviews.author: pearofkings

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and get an old school reliable guage.
customer_reviews.text: Good part: when it works it’s good. Bad part: constant menu changing to PSI, errors, sometimes doesn’t work at all, and gets stuck on wrong settings....and now constant blinking....useless and unreliable. Do yourself a favor and get an old school reliable guage.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ace

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but selection of units detracts
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and easy to use, but each time the trigger is depressed it rotates through the different displayed pressure units (psi, bars, etc). It's not easy to tell which units are being displayed and once you move off of psi, you have to push the trigger 3 more times to get back to psi. Sometimes the readout in a different unit implies the tire is low, when it's really not.
customer_reviews.author: MarkL

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck, accurate PSI measuring day or night.
customer_reviews.text: I LIKE to know my air pressure. its IMPORTANT to have even, precise air pressure! This goes down to 2psi and up to plenty high enough. is it annoying that the units change every time you press the button while its on? a little, but I can deal with it and it doesn't reset the current setting. Its a very accurate and cost effective way to check pressure. lights up for use at night! and lights the way when you are finding the shrader valve. Great for airing down when off-roading. Want 22psi or 18 or 5psi? no problem. This product is great no failures, no issues. I've used it for atleast a year or two.
customer_reviews.author: Santrelle

customer_reviews.title: didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: not satisfied with this product and seller, First time when i used it worked, i was happy that i bought this handy tool, yesterday i got flat tire on my motorcycle and i was happy that i have this thing to check right pressure after i fill air, but it just keep on blinking on 0:00:00, bad for me "Return windows is closed" and i can't find link to contact seller either, waste of money, going to buy mechanical this time, not digital
customer_reviews.author: Indi

product_meta.title: TEKTON Digital Tire Gauge | 5941
product_meta.description:
In any light, day or night, the TEKTON 5941 Digital Tire Gauge gives you an instant, accurate, and easy-to-read measurement of your vehicle's tire pressure. A simple push button turns the unit on and selects one of four measurement ranges. When it’s dark, the lighted nozzle illuminates your work area, so you can easily locate the valve stem. With gentle pressure, the nozzle seals onto the valve stem quickly and completely to deliver an accurate measurement. The exact measurement instantly displays on a clear, lighted digital screen, so there’s no guesswork or estimation like reading an analog gauge. After you’re done, a 30-second automatic shut off means you never have to worry about accidentally running the batteries dead. Contoured to fit your hand, the ergonomic shape is complemented by a soft, nonslip texture for ultimate comfort and control. Check your tire pressure often. Properly inflated tires keep you safe on the road and help you save on gas. Store this handy tool in your glove box or console, so it's always ready when you need it.

Specifications:

 * (4) measurement ranges: PSI: 0-100, bar: 0-7, kPa: 0-700, kg/cm2: 0-7
 * Minimum increment: 0.5 PSI
 * Power source: (1) CR2032 3V lithium coin cell, (3) LR44 1.5V button cells (all included)
feature_bullets: Lighted nozzle and display screen for ultimate visibility in low light or at night
Digital display instantly and clearly shows exact reading, eliminating the guesswork of analog gauges
Nozzle seals to valve stem for quick and accurate measurements
Simple push button control turns unit on, selects the desired range, and automatically shuts off after 30 seconds to save the batteries
Ergonomic design comfortably fits hand and features a soft, non-slip surface for sure grip
(1) CR2032 3V Lithium Coin Cell, (3) LR44 1.5V Button Cells (All Included)
For the product use please refer the instructions that are printed on the packaging
